topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0: Deploy the cURL Script Patch

body.p: This patch installs a cURL script on the lifecycle manager host that can be used to create Floating IP on the VRS-G node.
body.section: PrerequisitesHP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0 must be fully deployed before you can deploy this patch.

Download the patch
If you have not downloaded the patch, launch the Helion Distribution Network (HDN). You must obtain a user account on HDN in order to download these files. In a browser, navigate to Helion Download Network(HDN).
Click Sign In to log in using your account.
After signing in, click the Downloads link in the menu on the left side of the page.
Download the file and the associated checksum and signature files.
Verify the downloaded signature and the downloaded checksums.
Extract the compressed files until the HCG-CurlScript directory is available. The readme file will be at the level where you extract the HCG2.0_DCN003_Patch018.tar file.

ol.li: Copy the complete HCG-CurlScript to /var/hlm/clouds/<cloudname>/patches directory on lifecycle manager host.
Execute following command to apply patch hlm patch -c <cloud-name> -n HCG-CurlScript -t localhost
Once the above patch is deployed, the vrsg_curl_script.tar is installed in the /opt directory on lifecycle manager VM.

Execute the following command to extract the vrsg_curl_script.tar file: tar -vxf vrsg_curl_script.tar
The following files are extracted:
curl_vrsg_ha.sh
curl_vrsg_ha.txt
curl_vrsg_single.sh
curl-vrsg_single.txt
For information on configuring and running the cURL script, see Configuring Your Cloud with DCN VSD.
